content: अन्वयः [इ कर्तरि भावे वा अच्] {@--1@} Going after, following; also, follower, retinue, attendants; का त्वमेकाकिनी भीरु निरन्वयजने वने <ls>Bk. 5. 66.</ls> {@--2@} Association, connection, relation; गंधः कटुकान्वयः = कटुकान्वितः. {@--3@} The natural order or connection of words in a sentence, construing, grammatical order or relation; पदानां परस्पराकांक्षा योग्यता च, or शब्दानां परस्परमर्थानुगमनं; तात्पर्याख्यां वृत्तिमाहुः पदार्थान्वयबोधने S. D; logical connection of words, अत्र (in the ex. तिष्ठतु सर्पिः) सर्पिःशब्दस्य स्थितिक्रियायामन्वयः <ls>P. VIII. 3. 44</ls> Sk; परस्परनिरपेक्षस्यानेकस्य एकस्मिन्नन्वयः समुच्चयः <ls>P. II. 2. 29</ls> <ls>Sk.</ls> {@--4@} Drift, tenor, purport. {@--5@} Race, family, lineage; रघूणामन्वयं वक्ष्ये <ls>R. 1. 9</ls>, <ls n="R. 1.">12</ls>; <ls n="R.">3. 27</ls>; <ls n="R.">12. 33</ls>; अन्वयगुणः <ls>Mv. 4. 22</ls> virtue of my race. {@--6@} Descendants, posterity; ताभ्य ऋते अन्वयः <ls>Y. 2. 117</ls>; स° along with the family or descendants; <ls>Ms. 2. 168</ls>; <ls>Pt. 1. 27.</ls> {@--7@} Logical connection of cause and effect, logical continuance; जन्माद्यस्य यतोऽन्वयादितरतः <ls>Bhāg.</ls> {@--8@} Being seen (प्रत्यक्ष); स्यात्साहसं त्वन्वयवत् प्रसभं कर्म यत्कृतं . निरन्वयं भवेत्स्तेयं <ls>Ms. 8. 332.</ls> {@--9@} (In Nyāya) Statement of the constant and invariable concomitance of the हेतु (middle term) and the साध्य (major term) of an Indian syllogism (हेतुसाध्ययोर्व्याप्तिरन्वयः). In the familiar instance पर्वतो वह्निमान् धूमवत्त्वात् the relation यत्र यत्र धूमस्तत्र तत्र वह्निः (wherever there is smoke there is fire) is called अन्वय or अन्वयव्याप्ति, अन्वय, in fact, corresponds to the universal A proposition of European logic ‘All A is B.’ The ‘व्यतिरेकव्याप्ति’ means an assertion of the concomitance of the absence of साध्य and the absence of हेतु (तदभावयोः हेत्वभावसाध्याभावयोः व्याप्तिः) and corresponds to the converted A proposition ‘All notB is not-A’; or in Sanskrit यत्र यत्र वह्निर्नास्ति तत्र तत्र धूमोपि नास्ति; and a cause or हेतु is said to be connected with its effect by अन्वयव्यतिरेकव्याप्ति when both the affirmative and negative relations between the thing to be proved and the cause that proves can be equally asserted; such a {%Hetu%} alone makes the argument perfectly sound and incapable of refutation. This process of arriving at the Vyāpti or universal proposition corresponds to the methods of Agreement and Difference in Mill's Logic; साध्ये निश्चितमन्वयेन घटितं <ls>Mu. 5. 10.</ls>
